intro: Hiraea sericea, commonly known as silky hiraea, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Geraniaceae and is characterized by its hairy, silver-green foliage. The plant produces small, pale pink to white flowers that bloom in spring. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it suitable for rock gardens or dry landscapes. Due to its ornamental value and adaptability, it is often cultivated in gardens.
